messages.title: Vital Local Services need proper fair funding
messages.content: Our councils provide vital services to local people. At least they used to until the Government started making massive funding cuts – austerity. Many public services - care for the elderly, help for those with learning difficulties, child social services, Park and Ride facilities – have been cut to the bone.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Norwich Green councillors have said they will not support harsh and unnecessary cuts, and oppose those who need them most. The Green Party supports a more decentralised economy where more taxation is levied locally enabling expenditure decisions made at a local level.

mentions.candidate: Norwich South MP candidate, Lesley Grahame, wants to see a fairer city for all and you can help achieve this by electing her in May.

issues.economy: The Green Party supports a more decentralised economy where more taxation is levied locally enabling expenditure decisions made at a local level.
issues.socialWelfare: We need ways to fund vital services such as care for the elderly, help for those with learning difficulties, and child social services.

housing.content: The big Westminster parties – the austerity parties - are threatening to cut all central Government funding of local services by 2020.

leaflet.personalStatement: Lesley Grahame, wants to see a fairer city for all and you can help achieve this by electing her in May.

quotes.text: We urgently need new ways to fund vital services. As MP, I would fight further cuts in local funding from Whitehall. We also need a revolution in local government finance with new, fairer ways of local taxation, and innovative financing through schemes like local government bonds.

images.caption: Norwich Green Party - The newsletter of the Norwich Green Party: March 2015
